article.title: Remarks on the operator-norm convergence of the Trotter product formula

choices: The definition of the Trotter product formula.
The Taylor series expansion of the exponential function.
A telescopic representation used to prove the Trotter product formula.
The definition of a contraction semigroup.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Equation (1.2) state about the convergence of the Trotter product formula for bounded operators A and B?
choices: It converges with a rate of at least 1/n.
It converges only in the strong operator topology.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (1.5) defines an evolution semigroup. What does U(t,s) represent in this context?
choices: The propagator of the evolution semigroup.
The generator of the evolution semigroup.
The resolvent operator of the evolution semigroup.
The infinitesimal generator of the evolution semigroup.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the expression Rn(t, s; q) represent in Equation (3.5)?
choices: The exact value of the integral of q(y) from s to t.
The difference between the Trotter product formula and the semigroup generated by Do + Q.
The Darboux-Riemann sum approximation of the integral of q(y) from s to t.
The norm of the difference between consecutive terms in the Trotter product formula.
